::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)
```
:::



## Example 1 - Relation between body and brain weight for mammals {-}

Load the data:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Mammals <- read.csv( "Mammals.csv" )
```
:::


Let's compare linear scale (left) and logarithmic scale (right):


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
g1 <- ggplot( Mammals, aes( x=body, y=brain ) ) + geom_point() + 
  labs( title="Brain vs body weight on linear scale",
        x="Body Weight in kg", y="Brain weight in g" )

g2 <- g1 + coord_trans( x="log10", y="log10" )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: `coord_trans()` was deprecated in ggplot2 4.0.0.
â„¹ Please use `coord_transform()` instead.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
g1 + g2
```

## Example 2 - Analysis of Facebook Data


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
Facebook <- read.csv( "Facebook.csv", header=TRUE )

g1  <- ggplot( Facebook, aes( x=follow, y=postlikes ) ) + 
  geom_point() +
  labs( x="Number of Followers", y="Number of likes" )
g2 <- g1 + coord_trans( x="log", y="log" )
g1 + g2
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Change-in-Scale---Examples_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){fig-align='center' width=90%}
:::
:::


## Change of font size and theme


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
g2 <- g2 + theme_bw() +  
  theme( axis.title=element_text(size=16),
         axis.text=element_text(size=14) )
g1 + g2
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Change-in-Scale---Examples_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){fig-align='center' width=90%}
:::
:::
